title: The Antiquary - Volume 01
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: "But ye wadna wait to hear out my tale, Monkbarnsshe gaed out, and shecame in again with the gardener sae sune as she saw that nane o' ye wereclodded ower the Craig, and that Miss Wardour was safe in the chariot;she was hame a quarter of an hour syne, for it's now ganging tensairdroukit was she, puir thing, sae I e'en put a glass o' sherry in herwater-gruel."

title: Leaves from my diary, containing incidents connected with a sea voyage taken May 20, 1899, from New York to Naples.

snippet: We drove, Sept. 19, to Salisbury Craig, from which we had a fine view of the German Sea, the river Forth and the towns and villages below in the valley.

title: The captain of the guard.
author: Grant, James
snippet: Let us look, with him, over the rampart of this great tower, where his eyes survey a scene so different from v^hat is there to-day ; and yet Arthur's rocky cone, the hills of Fife, the fertile shores, the sandy bays and green islets of the Forth, are all unchanged as when the first Celtic settlers so truly named the great ridge that overlooks  them all, Scealla-hruach Craig, or " the rock of the beautiful view," now corrupted into Salisbury Craigs.

title: The captain of the guard.
author: Grant, James
snippet: In the beginning of the ninth century, Adrian, a holy man, became first- bishop of this see of St. Andrews, where in days, then long passed away, St. Hegulus and his kuldees had founded a cell dedicated to the Holy Virgin, about a bowshot westward from the shore, upon a sea- weedy rock named unto this day, Our Lady's Craig.

title: Sparks from a locomotive;

snippet: Tiie fifty-guinea prize poem, which was read at the Crystal Palace celebration in London, is the production of Miss Isa Craig, a native of Edinburg.

title: Bonnie Hills o'Hame, and other gems. [Verses.]

snippet: There lies propped up beside the museum a fossil tree,about thirty feet long and about nine feet at the bast,found at Craig leith Quarry.

title: Story of a Stolen Heir. A novel
